Part - III: (Defect Details)
a) Defect Category: Major
b) Defect Observed: Weapon release circuit malfunction. Abnormality observed during system test.
Part IV: Investigation: (Details of Examination including previous similar Defects)
a) Root Cause Analysis: Corrosion due to moisture accumulation in sealed compartment
b) Findings / Conclusions: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Countermeasure Dispenser component.
Physical examination revealed signs of wear and degradation.
c) Remedial Measures Clean and re-lubricate affected assemblies per technical manual
i. Corrective Action:
ii. Preventive Action: Introduce protective coating to prevent environmental degradation
d) Attributable Code: D - Due to features inherent in the design
Remarks: Thorough investigation completed. Preventive actions recommended.
Part V: Remarks by Design
Design assessment confirms component operated within specified limits. Recommend enhanced inspection protocol.
Date: 13/02/2024 Authorized Signatory of Design: Gp Capt V.S. Pillai
